website_summaries.verdict: Trail lovers who are about to embark on an adventure may come to appreciate the comfort and traction of this Columbia product. It also adds value to those who used it by granting lightness and ample protection from the elements.On the other hand, it is not able to satisfy everyone because of its footbed’s insufficient cushioning. All in all, the Columbia Redmond V2 Waterproof may still be a worthy trail performer, especially with the use of a new footbed to resolve its primary issue.
pros: Almost everyone who owns the Columbia Redmond V2 Waterproof agrees that it is a satisfyingly comfy hiking shoe
Its non-existent break-in period impresses a couple of verified purchasers
Numerous outdoor lovers are in awe of how grippy this footgear is
A couple of users testify to the waterproofness of this Columbia offering
More than a handful of shoppers mention that the Redmond V2 Waterproof is a delightfully lightweight shoe for hiking adventures
Based on a few consumer reviews, it is sturdy against most types of harsh trail conditions
cons: A minority of buyers say that the Columbia Redmond V2 Waterproof’s footbed lacks cushioning
Some owners experience sweaty feet when wearing this hiking shoe
According to a few customers, its lace slips and unties easily during a hike

customer_reviews.title: I'm never buying any other brand!
customer_reviews.text: These are brilliant! Super comfortable, sole is VERY resistant, they adjust perfectly to your feet, you don't get tired of wearing them while using them, give your feet breathing room, the material's quality is fantastic and they are quite versatile; can be worn for every situation: city walks, parks, wood adventure, hiking trails, you name it! In top of that, surprisingly cheap.!!! there's nothing to think about getting a pair of these. I DO RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: Omar GlRd

customer_reviews.title: 3 strikes & .......
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd pair of Columbia hikers I've tried in the past couple months. 1st was my usual size 9 reg,way to tight,next 9.5's were tight around the base of toes & that model didn't offer wide size so changed to this model that offered wide size.. 9.5 wide were still to snug. Both models looking down at them compared to my old hikers that I'm trying to replace looked like dress shoes,long & narrow,with my hikers wider with blunt toe box & real comfortable. I don't need serious hikers here in Fl but do need something that fits so will have to upgrade. Bottom line,don't buy Columbia shoes w/o free return shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable but cut small
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes but I think overall, this model of shoe is cut smaller. I don't usually wear a wide but I needed a wide because the toe box on the 9 regular, really squeezed my toes and it was super uncomfortable. The body of the shoe doesn't feel any wider than the 9 regular but there is much better room in the toe. I'm pretty hard on shoes, so only time will tell about durability.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: I live in Florida and the wife and I have been venturing out to state parks to keep occupied during COVID-19. I feel awkward calling it "hiking" since it's flat, but many trails here are sand which are not terribly comfortable to walk in regular shoes. I've taken these out to Rock Springs Run State Preserve and was quite pleased with their performance. The label says "breathable", and while it breathes better than a pair of solid upper Levi shoes I wear, it's not as good as regular sneakers. Still, if it keeps my feet dry through the mud or rain, I'll be content.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Ward

customer_reviews.title: Heavy compared to my old tennis, sizing is true.
customer_reviews.text: Glad that I won't have to return due to odd sizing - I wear a 16 wide - that's what I ordered and they fit perfectly. Good looking shoe even though it's all neutral colors. I bought them mainly for the waterproof feature - jury is still out as I've worn them only twice so far in nice weather. Quite a bit heavier than my new balance tennis shoes but the sole on the columbia's is much more hefty so I assume this is where the difference is.
customer_reviews.author: reo4ua

customer_reviews.title: Shoes that fit right
customer_reviews.text: I really appreciate that they give you the exact inches the shoes are. In my case, it was 13 1/4 inch. Many say 13 but they might be 13 inches with not a little extra or worse, not quite 13 inches. I’ve given several pairs that were just a little bit too short.
customer_reviews.author: Pinnie

customer_reviews.title: All-day comfort and perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something with a lower cut than a boot for winter wear and found these. They are comfortable enough that I wear them all day and part of the reason is they fit great. They are water proof, great for winter. They are supposed to be "breathable" and although they are not insulated, they are still pretty warm and do well in the cold weather. If they don't keep my feet warm enough for extended periods outdoors, well, that's what insulated boots are for! We'll see what summer brings.
customer_reviews.author: Dan L.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but not very durable
customer_reviews.text: The outsides of BOTH sides of the shoes ripped all the way thru to The inner fabric. I wore them off and on for a little over a month, rotating with other work shoes and boots depending on the day. I think I just got a defective pair.
customer_reviews.author: The Streeters Family

customer_reviews.title: Peculiarly Sized
customer_reviews.text: These shoes appear to be well made but they are too narrow and peculiarly sized. I wear a size 14 regular—EUR 48 or 49. A 14 in this shoe was too narrow and labeled EUR 46. Returned and ordered size 15 which was labeled EUR 48. As can be seen in the attached photo it’s longer than my size 14 Asolo hiking boots. Width was about correct for a size 14 regular. Returned the 2nd pair and will try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: ECB Sr

customer_reviews.title: OK Quality but very narrow
customer_reviews.text: The quality seems OK but the shoes are incredibly narrow. I've owned multiple other columbia hiking shoe models without an issue but my feet bulge out over the soles on these like a muffin top. I've never had to order "wide" sizing in any other shoes so I'm assuming that these are extra narrow. I ended up returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: NOT WATERPROOF
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because it was advertised as waterproof, the first time walking through wet grass my feet were completely soaked. Definitely disappointed that it couldn’t even repel water from grass. After two weeks of where the bottom of both shoes started breaking apart. Definitely would not recommend the shoes to anybody for anything
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. Most comfortable I think I have ever worn. Needs 1/2 sizes. I wear a 12 wide in every other shoe/boot. 12 w too small and 13 r hurt the top of my ankle because it's too big. Would be 5 if it had half sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Clemons

customer_reviews.title: Awesome in Sedona/ Christmas 2019!
customer_reviews.text: I just used these for 3 hikes, and the Grand Canyon; all in (or after) wintery, muddy conditions. My feet were warm, dry, and had great traction. I would buy them again, and would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jacobass

customer_reviews.title: Okay, first thing is that they are shoes...
customer_reviews.text: ...but they are really good shoes. Really, really good shoes. Comfortable for all day wear. Rocks, sticks, uneven terrain, it is just a pleasure to be hiking in these. Or working in the garden. Or walking the beach. I usually wear a pair of shoes until they are fully dead. After my purchase, I bought a second pair within two weeks, not because the first were a problem I bought the second pair because the first is no problem at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best waterproof shoe available
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet and the wide variant fits perfectly. I walk daily in an urban environment in a rainy city and needed a waterproof shoe. I've tried many shoes from many stores and this is the only shoe which is both nice enough to wear to work (black shoe, corporate office) and comfortable for frequent walking. Will be buying a second pair in a different color.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Columbia quality as expected.
customer_reviews.text: If you’re a regular width buy the wide size. Decent, comfortable hiker with good sole. What you’d expect from Columbia. Waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: relkin

customer_reviews.title: Nice and comfortable  (size 9 1/2 D)
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for light trail walking and casual wear, my first pair in my normal size was too tight in length and width, so I ordered the exchange pair in 1/2 size larger and in wide (size 10wide ) fit great, comfortable and good support and a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying the same size in similar columbia sneakers for years. These are too small around the top of foot, and too shallow at heel. They say 11.5 wide, but feel like size 11. The short looks nice and appears to be well made.
customer_reviews.author: Aulstar

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable - order half size up!
customer_reviews.text: I am normally a size 7 in men's (8.5 in women's), but I measured according to their size guide and ordered the 7.5. It fit perfectly. They're very soft and comfortable to walk in so far and look stylish. The black will likely get really dusty, but since they're waterproof, they should be easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these shoes. There was the normal not-as-comfortable breaking in phase the first week that he wore them, and now they’re great. We live in the PNW and quality waterproof gear is a must. Nice, affordable option.
customer_reviews.author: Anony.Mouse

customer_reviews.title: They run small, narrow, but they walk dry
customer_reviews.text: Had to go up a size and also get a wide (which is no more than 1/8" wider, so I doubt any M wearer would have a problem w/a wide, probably would not notice). When my regular size did not fit, I did a sanity check with my tailor's tape and measured my old shoes (tip to heel inside) sure enough they were 1/2" longer inside than the same size in columbia so I went up a size which worked. Walked 4mi in wet grass, outside mesh was soaked, but inside my socks were bone dry, didn't sweat, and no blisters on first wear. Lightweight too.
customer_reviews.author: Kraken

customer_reviews.title: Run too short and too narrow
customer_reviews.text: Would have given 5 stars if they fit. They were too narrow and too short so remember that when ordering. I returned these and bought sketchers instead which fit fine. Just so you know I always wear the same size.
customer_reviews.author: Bren from Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Singing in the rain
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son who is a student at UTK. He walks a ton and it has been so rainy here that he was tired of his shoes getting soaked. He says they are comfortable and held up great in today's rainfall. I've always been please with the Columbia brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been hiking short 2-3 mile trails . I wanted some actual hiking shoes and not just my old nike running shoes. I’ve had this pair of Columbia shoes for about 2 months now. I’ve been doing moderate 2-3 mile hikes. They have ripped. I’m so disappointed. Not even 3 months with the shoes and they tore on the side . That’s something I expect from a shoe If I’ve had them for years not 3 months. Now I’m looking for a new hiking shoe. I’m highly disappointed and annoyed that I’ve got to look for a new hiking shoes
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Limited use.
customer_reviews.text: Good for hiking on dry surfaces but very slick on wet rocky surfaces. My Keenes don’t slip a bit. I would not recommend for fishing or hiking on rocky surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R

customer_reviews.title: Ripped on Day 5!
customer_reviews.text: Ripped on Day 5!! These shoes seemed great - comfort, quality, fit. But they ripped on Day 5 with very light wear. See photos - shoe treads like new but entire side of shoe is ripped! Very disappointed in Columbia and would like a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Rastovac

customer_reviews.title: Perfect all terrain dog walking shoes
customer_reviews.text: My wife says these shows should fit big to be correctly fit. She is a trained fitness expert. I find these to be snug. I like that fit.
customer_reviews.author: jc noevil

customer_reviews.title: Very dependable shoe
customer_reviews.text: I'm replacing the same shoes that wore out from heavy use. I highly recommend this shoe for street or light trail hiking.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Nice boot but they are not as wide
customer_reviews.text: I wear wide shoe and most time the wide shoe fits great. These are a little tight across the bridge. Other wise great boots
customer_reviews.author: Tom L.

customer_reviews.title: Like many other reviews TOO NARROW - EVEN WITH WIDE
customer_reviews.text: I don't wear a Wide normally. But I ordered it for these shoes after reading the reviews. Still super tight, way too narrow. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: HealthIT

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Didn't fit well, sent back, nice enough looking but what good is that if they don't fit correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Leilani Hall

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Same size I always order from Columbia, they fit small. Also the tounge is short and more narrow than any previous pair of Columbia’s I’ve ever had, so that is uncomfortable as well. I have been a Columbia fan many years and these shoes are a huge disappointment. Huge downward trend in quality. Don’t bother buying. And you may want to consider alternative brands as I certainly will be.
customer_reviews.author: connie l.

customer_reviews.title: Try these before spending 150 on other hiking shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. These are the second pair of Columbia’s hiking shoes I have had. They are more comfortable and hold up just as well as 150$ dollars Merrells.
customer_reviews.author: John Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Shoe story
customer_reviews.text: These do not fit as well as the brown pair I bought a few months ago But they are okay and the traction is good
customer_reviews.author: Arnold Malhmood

customer_reviews.title: True water proof
customer_reviews.text: Kids love the shoes. True water proof. But it's a little bit of bigger than I thought.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: They are waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Can wear them in the rain and they’re pretty comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Ned C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excelkent
customer_reviews.text: They where for my sona pkane mechanic he says are soft and confortable.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe Beauregard

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Not as comfortable as non waterproof. Not enough padding and support.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Way too small
customer_reviews.text: I order the same size of this brand and shoe type and boy was it small and tight. Tried to stretch them with no luck. A size 10 is really a size 9.5 or smaller.
customer_reviews.author: william b

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, reliable, durable!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable! Great quality! Will be purchasing more from the brand in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Kendrick Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good show.
customer_reviews.text: Like the shoe. Fits as expected. Comfortable. We camp a lot so will be using for camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: David Barkman

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a wide 10, got a regular 10 and it was very tight and small. I'm a consistent 10 and this shoe didnt fit at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not bad for the price range
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 13ee and it fits well. A little stiff and flat on the soles and arch support for me, but not bad for the price range.
customer_reviews.author: George P

customer_reviews.title: Great value, good for narrower feet
customer_reviews.text: I have narrow feet and they fit well. They are hot because they are waterproof, but the waterproofing performs well. Very supportive and comfortable otherwise
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J Horowitz

customer_reviews.title: Fits small
customer_reviews.text: Normally wear a 13 regular in most shoes. Went from 13 to 13 wide and then returned them again to go to a different shoe. No noticeable difference from 13 to 13W.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Grange

customer_reviews.title: Fit great. Amazing price.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. Fit like a glove. Have worn on two long hikes. One quite steep. Great support.
customer_reviews.author: Michael the Canadian

customer_reviews.title: Great looking shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the wide, but it didn't fit like a wide. So I returned the item. Process was quick and easy. So happy Kohls takes Amazon returns. The shoe looked great and seemed to be made well.....can't say any more since I never wore.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Narrow..Narrow... Narrow
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the shoe makes it a five star, but not being able to wear the narrow fit makes it only 3. I didn't want to wait to see if the shoe loosened up so I could wear them comfortably. I returned them immediately.
customer_reviews.author: promethea

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: These were delivered May 31. I haven’t done any “tough hiking” or anything crazy. I wanted comfortable waterproof shoes to walk my dog. Disappointed they didn’t last more than 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: I like the omni-directional, gripping sole pattern on these hiking shoes. Perfect for those rough trails.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Estepp

customer_reviews.title: Fit too small
customer_reviews.text: Ordered size 13 wide. Right out of the box they hurt my feet. Toes were crammed in. One caveat. Return was easy and much less painful than the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Durability
customer_reviews.text: Had this shoe for 40 days and it riped out the side
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable for hiking, walking or working outdoors.
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected, very comfortable for hiking, walking or working outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Harry  J. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t fit
customer_reviews.text: The shoes were too tight. Ordered the right size, but they run smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Faydaygirl

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart
customer_reviews.text: It entire show fell apart after my 3rd hike pretty moderate hike- the material just tore apart. Walmart brand $20 brand crap holds up better
customer_reviews.author: Matthew vogan

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoe, my pair were not durable.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, extremely comfortable, didn’t take long to break in, but I only had them for about a week and just after two hikes I got a large tear in the leather. Great feeling shoe, not very durable.
customer_reviews.author: madeleine

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for a hike & my husband loved them. Very comfortable and light weight
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Jaimes

customer_reviews.title: Order up Half a Size
customer_reviews.text: Seem like nice shoes but were definitely a half size too small. Had to return.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Paul

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Wore for 3 months and stitching already coming apart. Hole big enough to stick my thumb into, and growing.
customer_reviews.author: kevin kunzen

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size received.
customer_reviews.text: I requested. size 9W (wide) but instead received a size 9 that was too narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Gaston

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Fit exactly as expected. I've only worn these a few times since I received them, but I've noticed they do a great job keeping my feet warm.
customer_reviews.author: SmittyJ

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes
customer_reviews.text: The shoes seem to be good! I used once only so far but all good
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Hopes ripped apart
customer_reviews.text: Shoe ripped 5 weeks after I got them. I've had Columbia before and been satisfied, very dissapointed in this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Little small in size took forever to break in. 4 months later one shoe split at side seam! Unhappy
customer_reviews.author: Todd B. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: Nice, well made, just wasn’t the right fit for me
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: that the shoe doesn't cramp my foot
customer_reviews.text: I walk 3 - 5 miles a day. I needed a hiking/walking shoe that could feel tight and pain free. I got it.
customer_reviews.author: John S. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Shoes fit as expected. Very comfortable for longer hikes in average/moderate terrain. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: Shoes don't have much padding on the inside, heel of shoe very hard on the feet, need better insoles
customer_reviews.author: Arthritis sufferer

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes
customer_reviews.text: Been using Columbia shoes for years, good quality and price
customer_reviews.author: Wai Lng

customer_reviews.title: Not at all waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: Not at all waterproof!!! Not for one second!!! Totally false !!!
customer_reviews.author: C. Jacks

customer_reviews.title: Columbia products are always an excellent choice
customer_reviews.text: Just what I expected very comfortable and perfect fit right out of the box
customer_reviews.author: David Whidden

customer_reviews.title: size and width run small
customer_reviews.text: to small and too narrow. like all Chinese products. buy American
customer_reviews.author: Y. Miller

product_meta.title: Columbia Men's Redmond V2 Waterproof Hiking Shoe
product_meta.description: A durable, waterproof hiker that provides great traction and comfort..
feature_bullets: Combination suede leather, mesh and webbing. Omni-Tech waterproof breathable seam-sealed membrane bootie construction
International products have separate terms, are sold from abroad and may differ from local products, including fit, age ratings, and language of product, labeling or instructions.
